function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Inability to find and treat the abundance of potential breeding sites for immature mosquito stages.","Impact":"Increased propagation of mosquito population and potential spread of vectorborne diseases.","Mitigation":"Implement advanced surveillance and mapping technologies to identify and target breeding sites.","Technologies":"GIS mapping, drone surveillance, IoT sensors for environmental monitoring.","People":"Communities residing in areas with potential breeding sites, public health organizations.","Owner":"Public health organizations, local government authorities."},{"Description":"Unclear efficacy of personal protective methods against daytime biting mosquitoes.","Impact":"Potential exposure to vectorborne diseases for individuals relying on these methods for protection.","Mitigation":"Conduct research to determine the efficacy of personal protective methods against daytime biting mosquitoes, and educate the community on alternative protection strategies.","Technologies":"Field studies, entomological research, community education campaigns.","People":"Individuals relying on personal protective methods, public health educators, researchers.","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations."},{"Description":"Insufficient methods for targeting new invasive mosquito species and promoting green spaces in urban settings.","Impact":"Increased risk of vectorborne diseases due to inadequate vector control measures for new invasive species.","Mitigation":"Develop and implement innovative intervention methods specific to new invasive species and urban green spaces, and integrate ecological management practices for vector control.","Technologies":"Genetic modification, ecological modeling, urban planning technologies.","People":"Urban communities, environmental policymakers, public health organizations.","Owner":"Environmental agencies, urban planning authorities, public health organizations."},{"Description":"Reliance on adult female mosquitoes to disseminate insecticide-auto-dissemination for targeting Ae. aegypti.","Impact":"Potential unintended consequences from using mosquitoes as carriers of insecticides and uncertain effectiveness of the method.","Mitigation":"Conduct thorough risk assessments and field trials to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of insecticide-auto-dissemination before widespread implementation.","Technologies":"Entomological research, field trials, risk assessment tools.","People":"Communities in targeted areas, public health organizations, researchers.","Owner":"Entomological research institutions, public health organizations, regulatory agencies."}]}
